column2: In Kansas, spring usually falls on the day before summer. It had been such a day, and now at midnight I was sitting at my desk.
column3: In Kansas, spring usually falls on the day before summer. It had been such a day, and now at midnight I was sitting at my desk.

column2: Both hands of the clock were pointing to the ceiling and to the limitless stars beyond. My wife and daughter had long been asleep.
column3: Both hands of the clock were pointing to the ceiling and to the limitless stars beyond. My wife and daughter had long been asleep.

column2: I had stayed up to write a few letters but it was not a night for working.
column3: I had stayed up to write a few letters but it was not a night for working.

column2: Although it was a bit chilly outside, the moon was bright and a bird was singing a glad and plaintive song about the summer that was coming and all the summers that had passed and all that would be.
column3: Although it was a bit chilly outside, the moon was bright and a bird was singing a glad and plaintive song about the summer that was coming and all the summers that had passed and all that would be.

column2: Adding, here and there, a bit of melody about all the good things that happen to birds and men without their knowing why.
column3: Adding, here and there, a bit of melody about all the good things that happen to birds and men without their knowing why.

column2: Both hands of the clock were pointing upward. And I was half-asleep, and half-dreaming. Remembering all the friends I had most of them scattered to the four winds by now.
column3: Both hands of the clock were pointing upward. And I was half-asleep, and half-dreaming. Remembering all the friends I had most of them scattered to the four winds by now.

column2: And that best friend of all, Doctor Jack Odin! I wondered where he was and how he had fared since he disappeared into that dark cave in Texas.
column3: And that best friend of all, Doctor Jack Odin! I wondered where he was and how he had fared since he disappeared into that dark cave in Texas.

column2: Suddenly I became aware of a flickering light above me. I looked up. I had thought that the lights were winking, but they were not.
column3: Suddenly I became aware of a flickering light above me. I looked up. I had thought that the lights were winking, but they were not.

column2: The room was lit by a reading lamp, and the ceiling was so shadowy that at first I could see nothing at all. Then I saw the light or the ghost of a light gleaming faintly upon or through the ceiling.
column3: The room was lit by a reading lamp, and the ceiling was so shadowy that at first I could see nothing at all. Then I saw the light or the ghost of a light gleaming faintly upon or through the ceiling.

column2: It was the faintest yellow, neither a bull's eye nor a splotch. Instead, it seemed to be a tiny whirlpool of movement the faintest nebula in miniature with spirals of light swiftly circling a central core.
column3: It was the faintest yellow, neither a bull's eye nor a splotch. Instead, it seemed to be a tiny whirlpool of movement the faintest nebula in miniature with spirals of light swiftly circling a central core.

column2: For a second I thought I could see through the roof, and the stars swarmed before me. It was as though I was at the vortex of a high whirlwind of dancing, shining specks of light.
column3: For a second I thought I could see through the roof, and the stars swarmed before me. It was as though I was at the vortex of a high whirlwind of dancing, shining specks of light.

column2: Then that sensation was gone, and there were two faint coiling spirals of yellow light upon the ceiling.
column3: Then that sensation was gone, and there were two faint coiling spirals of yellow light upon the ceiling.

column2: The lights began to whisper.
column3: The lights began to whisper.

column2: We are Ato and Wolden, they said. Remember us?
column3: We are Ato and Wolden, they said. Remember us?

column2: I remembered them from the notes that I had pieced together to tell the story of my old friend, Doctor Jack Odin, and his adventure in the World of Opal.
column3: I remembered them from the notes that I had pieced together to tell the story of my old friend, Doctor Jack Odin, and his adventure in the World of Opal.

column2: It seemed impolite to tell them that we had never met. So I listened.
column3: It seemed impolite to tell them that we had never met. So I listened.

column2: Wolden's work has succeeded, the whispering continued. We have reduced time and space to nothing. You see us as lights, or as we once put it, 'as flame-winged butterflies,' but we are neither.
column3: Wolden's work has succeeded, the whispering continued. We have reduced time and space to nothing. You see us as lights, or as we once put it, 'as flame-winged butterflies,' but we are neither.

column2: We are Ato and Wolden. By adding ourselves to another dimension we are hardly recognizable to you.
column3: We are Ato and Wolden. By adding ourselves to another dimension we are hardly recognizable to you.

column2: Actually, we are at our starting point billions of miles away! We are traveling through space toward you at a speed which would make the speed of light look like a glow-worm crawling across the dark ground;
column3: Actually, we are at our starting point billions of miles away! We are traveling through space toward you at a speed which would make the speed of light look like a glow-worm crawling across the dark ground;

column2: and at the same time, we are there in your room. Do you understand?
column3: and at the same time, we are there in your room. Do you understand?

column2: I didn't, but I have learned that a man can live quite comfortably by merely keeping his mouth shut. So I kept still.
column3: I didn't, but I have learned that a man can live quite comfortably by merely keeping his mouth shut. So I kept still.

column2: My little daughter had been playing in the room before she had unwillingly gone to bed. She had left a red rubber ball upon my desk.
column3: My little daughter had been playing in the room before she had unwillingly gone to bed. She had left a red rubber ball upon my desk.

column2: Look at the ball, the voices whispered. We will give you an idea of the time-space in which we live.
column3: Look at the ball, the voices whispered. We will give you an idea of the time-space in which we live.

column2: I looked. Suddenly the little ball twitched, vanished and reappeared. I gazed in wonder. It had been red. Now it was white.
column3: I looked. Suddenly the little ball twitched, vanished and reappeared. I gazed in wonder. It had been red. Now it was white.

column2: I picked it up and a white powder rubbed off upon my fingertips.
column3: I picked it up and a white powder rubbed off upon my fingertips.

column2: See. The lights whispered. We have turned it inside out The whispering continued.
column3: See. The lights whispered. We have turned it inside out The whispering continued.

column2: We are bringing you a gift. Our last gift, probably, because we are weary of your world and the affairs of men. Pygmies! Now, stand back from your desk It was such a command that I fairly leaped out of my chair and drew away from the desk.
column3: We are bringing you a gift. Our last gift, probably, because we are weary of your world and the affairs of men. Pygmies! Now, stand back from your desk It was such a command that I fairly leaped out of my chair and drew away from the desk.

column2: Still leaning upon it I stared in wonder at the shadow which was forming itself upon the cleared space by the side of my typewriter.
column3: Still leaning upon it I stared in wonder at the shadow which was forming itself upon the cleared space by the side of my typewriter.

column2: At first it was merely a dark square. Then it was a shadowy cube, growing denser all the time until it became a dim shape. The shape grew brighter.
column3: At first it was merely a dark square. Then it was a shadowy cube, growing denser all the time until it became a dim shape. The shape grew brighter.

column2: There was a tiny spitting sound, like two hot wires being touched together.
column3: There was a tiny spitting sound, like two hot wires being touched together.

column2: There was a smell in the room, not unpleasant but not pleasant either a completely alien smell. A wave of cold air struck me, and passed by, leaving me shivering.
column3: There was a smell in the room, not unpleasant but not pleasant either a completely alien smell. A wave of cold air struck me, and passed by, leaving me shivering.

column2: Our furnace came on with a start.
column3: Our furnace came on with a start.

column2: Then the lights were gone and I was looking in wonder at a leaden box, about a foot square. It had a hinged lid, and around the middle of it the figure of a snake was excellently carved.
column3: Then the lights were gone and I was looking in wonder at a leaden box, about a foot square. It had a hinged lid, and around the middle of it the figure of a snake was excellently carved.

column2: It held its tail in its mouth, locking the box securely. Its eyes were two great moonstones that appeared to look up at me with half-blind amusement winking at the wisdom they had forgotten and the fear that I was feeling.
column3: It held its tail in its mouth, locking the box securely. Its eyes were two great moonstones that appeared to look up at me with half-blind amusement winking at the wisdom they had forgotten and the fear that I was feeling.

column2: I touched the box and drew my hand away in pain. It was colder than cold.
column3: I touched the box and drew my hand away in pain. It was colder than cold.

column2: Desolate, burning cold.
column3: Desolate, burning cold.

column2: It was two hours before the box became warm enough or cool enough to touch. Then, after several experiments I got the snake's mouth open and the lid swung upward on chilled hinges.
column3: It was two hours before the box became warm enough or cool enough to touch. Then, after several experiments I got the snake's mouth open and the lid swung upward on chilled hinges.

column2: Within it was a manuscript. As soon as I looked at it I recognized the handwriting of my old friend, Doctor Jack Odin.
column3: Within it was a manuscript. As soon as I looked at it I recognized the handwriting of my old friend, Doctor Jack Odin.

column2: Well, it was just as before. It was more of a series of notes and jottings than a story. It took months to piece it together.
column3: Well, it was just as before. It was more of a series of notes and jottings than a story. It took months to piece it together.

column2: Several pages were badly burned and spotted. It was hard work and slow work And this is the tale that Jack Odin sent me from Somewhere.
column3: Several pages were badly burned and spotted. It was hard work and slow work And this is the tale that Jack Odin sent me from Somewhere.

column2: Jack Odin descended into the cavern or what Keefe had called the Hole for less than a hundred yards before his strong flashlight sent its lancing beam into a stone wall.
column3: Jack Odin descended into the cavern or what Keefe had called the Hole for less than a hundred yards before his strong flashlight sent its lancing beam into a stone wall.

column2: At his feet was a crevice which went straight down as though it had been measured by a giant square. He got to his knees and looked over.
column3: At his feet was a crevice which went straight down as though it had been measured by a giant square. He got to his knees and looked over.

column2: Playing his light around he detected a few ledges like narrow steps far below. It was pitch-dark down there, and not even his strong light could reach to the bottom.
column3: Playing his light around he detected a few ledges like narrow steps far below. It was pitch-dark down there, and not even his strong light could reach to the bottom.

column2: He tried tossing a few pebbles into it;
column3: He tried tossing a few pebbles into it;

column2: listening he heard the faint rattle of their fall, but could not be sure whether they had landed on one of the ledges or had reached bottom.
column3: listening he heard the faint rattle of their fall, but could not be sure whether they had landed on one of the ledges or had reached bottom.

column2: Looking about him, he found a weathered bit of limestone that thrust itself up like a small table. It did not look very substantial but it was his only hope.
column3: Looking about him, he found a weathered bit of limestone that thrust itself up like a small table. It did not look very substantial but it was his only hope.

column2: Odin had crammed his ammunition, food and canteen into a knapsack.
column3: Odin had crammed his ammunition, food and canteen into a knapsack.

column2: Looping the rope through it and his rifle strap, he lowered them over until he felt the rope slacken as his gun and supplies rested upon the first ledge.
column3: Looping the rope through it and his rifle strap, he lowered them over until he felt the rope slacken as his gun and supplies rested upon the first ledge.

column2: Releasing one end of the rope he carefully drew it back.
column3: Releasing one end of the rope he carefully drew it back.

column2: Now he knotted the rope about the stone and let the two lengths of it trail down toward the ledge. He had kept his flashlight which he thrust into his belt.
column3: Now he knotted the rope about the stone and let the two lengths of it trail down toward the ledge. He had kept his flashlight which he thrust into his belt.

column2: One other thing, a little miner's cap and light, now came into use.
column3: One other thing, a little miner's cap and light, now came into use.

column2: It was warm down there, and as soon as the cap with its lighted lamp was on his head, sweat began to pour down his neck. Suddenly he remembered a scene he had witnessed one morning in West Virginia so long ago that it should have been forgotten.
column3: It was warm down there, and as soon as the cap with its lighted lamp was on his head, sweat began to pour down his neck. Suddenly he remembered a scene he had witnessed one morning in West Virginia so long ago that it should have been forgotten.

column2: His car had stalled in a tiny town one evening. He had slept in the only hotel, but had got up before daybreak so he could start an early search for a mechanic.
column3: His car had stalled in a tiny town one evening. He had slept in the only hotel, but had got up before daybreak so he could start an early search for a mechanic.

column2: Looking up toward the hills he had seen a silent procession of lights going upward to some unknown mine. There was something grotesque about those climbing lights; the identity of the men was lost, and this was a crawling thing up there on the hillside.

column2: Then he laughed. Better feel a bit sorry for Jack Odin too. Getting ready to lower himself over a precipice, and not having the slightest idea when he would reach bottom.

column2: Well, one could stay here and think until doomsday. So, with a shrug of his big shoulders, he got a firm grip on his doubled rope and slid over the edge.
column3: Well, one could stay here and think until doomsday. So, with a shrug of his big shoulders, he got a firm grip on his doubled rope and slid over the edge.

column3: He went down and down until his shoulders ached. Once he got his feet down on an outcropping but dared not brace himself there for fear of loosening his rope from its unsteady mooring above.

column2: Then, at last, he came to the ledge with only a few feet of his doubled rope to spare.
column3: Then, at last, he came to the ledge with only a few feet of his doubled rope to spare.

column3: After resting the little cap and lamp in a secure cranny he lay flat on his stomach for a few minutes, gulping great draughts of air and trying to rub some feeling back into his aching shoulders.

column2: Then he got up and started looking about for some anchorage. Some twenty feet away, he found a little spur of rock.
column3: Then he got up and started looking about for some anchorage. Some twenty feet away, he found a little spur of rock.

column2: The second ledge was negotiated in the same fashion as the first. It was scarcely four feet in width.

column3: Not even a single out-cropping. The wall was smooth and glassy as though at one time, for ages and ages, water had flown down it and had left a glossy coating upon its face.

column3: Poor fellow, he is dead now, but if we of Opal went in for monuments we would build one a mile high for Zol. He told us that Grim Hagen was readying the Old Ship for flight into space.

column3: For a week we heard from Zol. He gave the ruby capsule to Maya. She sleeps and will continue to sleep for twenty years unless the antidote which looks like curdled yellow flame is given to her.

column2: Gunnar continued. Well, it has turned out even as I figured. Only more so. When traveling in far countries you should try to learn how the people live, Odin.

column2: Please, Gunnar. When will we see Maya So, I have been working ever since we arrived. A jewel here. A bit of gold there. It is amazing how a diamond can make a man see just what you tell him to see.
column3: Please, Gunnar. When will we see Maya So, I have been working ever since we arrived. A jewel here. A bit of gold there. It is amazing how a diamond can make a man see just what you tell him to see.

column2: Much better than ordinary glasses. Then I found Piper here. And Piper is ambitious. Do you know what it costs to become head-man and chief tax-gatherer of a town of five-thousand, Odin?

column2: And another voice answered. You're always seeing things. A log, maybe. Didn't I tell you that I found some money in the street? And aren't we going to have the best meal that money can buy?

column2: They waited. A peculiar little whistle sounded three notes from the darkness.

column3: As though reassured, Piper took up his oars.

column3: He took them and slid them into their hole-pins. Now, give Gunnar room.

column2: He'll go far maybe.

column3: The best of a planet's treasures and art had been brought here. But all he could see was Maya, lying upon a golden, diamond-set couch.

column3: A silk embroidered coverlet was drawn over her, and it too seemed to have been spun from moonbeams. She looked no older. Odin could see no sign of breath.

column2: Turn the light upon her forearm, now, he instructed.

column2: I dreamed the strangest dreams.

column3: Never mind, Odin comforted. We will explain later. Can you walk now?

column3: A dozen cloaked figures came into the room. The first was Grim Hagen, smiling sardonically. The others were Brons. The last to enter was carrying poor Piper's dripping head by a handful of hair.

column3: Odin felt his muscles harden as though a hundred charley-horses had struck him at once. He froze, and out of the corner of his eye he saw Gunnar standing like a statue,

column3: Now Grim Hagen spied Odin and Gunnar as they advanced to help Ato.

column2: Standing upon the dais, his face livid with rage, Hagen pointed to them and screamed as mad as any of the last Caesars who had gone insane from too much power.
column3: Standing upon the dais, his face livid with rage, Hagen pointed to them and screamed as mad as any of the last Caesars who had gone insane from too much power.

column2: Look, men of the Lorens, Hagen cried, still pointing. I will give immortality to the men who bring me those two alive.
column3: Look, men of the Lorens, Hagen cried, still pointing. I will give immortality to the men who bring me those two alive.

column2: The first two to reach Gunnar and Odin died at the end of Gunnar's and Odin's swords.
column3: The first two to reach Gunnar and Odin died at the end of Gunnar's and Odin's swords.

column2: Your immortality does not last very long, Grim Hagen, Gunnar shouted as he wiped his blade.
column3: Your immortality does not last very long, Grim Hagen, Gunnar shouted as he wiped his blade.

column2: Then another man came up the stairway. Odin killed him and flung him back upon the men who followed.
column3: Then another man came up the stairway. Odin killed him and flung him back upon the men who followed.

column2: But reinforcements were pouring in from other lanes. Grim Hagen and his men now numbered over a thousand.
column3: But reinforcements were pouring in from other lanes. Grim Hagen and his men now numbered over a thousand.

column2: Seeing Odin and Gunnar, Ato swung his men over against the subway entrance.
column3: Seeing Odin and Gunnar, Ato swung his men over against the subway entrance.

column2: They rallied there. Grim Hagen's soldiers came at them. Ato, Gunnar, and Odin stood side by side and led the counter-attack that forced them back upon Grim Hagen's strange machine.
column3: They rallied there. Grim Hagen's soldiers came at them. Ato, Gunnar, and Odin stood side by side and led the counter-attack that forced them back upon Grim Hagen's strange machine.

column2: But Hagen's men rallied and drove them back again almost to the stairway.
column3: But Hagen's men rallied and drove them back again almost to the stairway.

column2: The next drive will get us, Ato groaned. Brace yourselves, men.
column3: The next drive will get us, Ato groaned. Brace yourselves, men.

column2: But the next drive did not come. Suddenly a dozen screaming wretches they could no longer be called soldiers came running up the street.
column3: But the next drive did not come. Suddenly a dozen screaming wretches they could no longer be called soldiers came running up the street.

column2: They joined Grim Hagen's men and gibbered in fear as they pointed back.
column3: They joined Grim Hagen's men and gibbered in fear as they pointed back.

column2: From down there came a sudden burst of music. Odin's heart leaped when he heard it. It was the old song of the Brons. But the lights were burning low back there and as yet he could see nothing.
column3: From down there came a sudden burst of music. Odin's heart leaped when he heard it. It was the old song of the Brons. But the lights were burning low back there and as yet he could see nothing.

column2: Then they came. Nea and Maya, walking side by side. Behind them were half a dozen women, playing fifes and horns. One was carrying a tattered flag.
column3: Then they came. Nea and Maya, walking side by side. Behind them were half a dozen women, playing fifes and horns. One was carrying a tattered flag.

column2: Behind the musicians came a motley crowd. Old women, young women, half-grown children, and dozens of old men. All were armed.
column3: Behind the musicians came a motley crowd. Old women, young women, half-grown children, and dozens of old men. All were armed.

column2: And they came forward like the wrack of a surviving army at judgement day.
column3: And they came forward like the wrack of a surviving army at judgement day.

column2: Oh, there was something noble about them, and pitiful too. And something terrible. For before them, floating upon the air like bobbing heads were Nea's four fantoms,
column3: Oh, there was something noble about them, and pitiful too. And something terrible. For before them, floating upon the air like bobbing heads were Nea's four fantoms,

column2: the Kalis, whining hungrily as they came, their copper hair trailing about them.
column3: the Kalis, whining hungrily as they came, their copper hair trailing about them.

column2: One caught a fugitive as he lagged behind and he died screaming.
column3: One caught a fugitive as he lagged behind and he died screaming.

column2: The Kalis darted this way and that and Grim Hagen's men writhed. Their muscles clenched. Their jaws set as though tetanus had struck them.
column3: The Kalis darted this way and that and Grim Hagen's men writhed. Their muscles clenched. Their jaws set as though tetanus had struck them.

column2: They slid to the marble street and died.
column3: They slid to the marble street and died.

column2: And the Kalis laughed and whined and screamed as they fed. Even above their feeding-song and the screams of their victims came the shrill, triumphant cry of Nea urging them on.
column3: And the Kalis laughed and whined and screamed as they fed. Even above their feeding-song and the screams of their victims came the shrill, triumphant cry of Nea urging them on.

column2: Nor was the rest of Maya's army still. One old Bron who had been a slave of Grim Hagen for too long had found a shotgun among Hagen's treasures and was blasting away.
column3: Nor was the rest of Maya's army still. One old Bron who had been a slave of Grim Hagen for too long had found a shotgun among Hagen's treasures and was blasting away.

column2: They were armed with everything from staves, blunderbusses, old forty-fours and Sharps rifles to machine guns. They fired and fired.
column3: They were armed with everything from staves, blunderbusses, old forty-fours and Sharps rifles to machine guns. They fired and fired.

column2: Grim Hagen's men went down. But though dozens of ill-aimed shots were fired at him, Grim Hagen still lived, dodging here and there, rallying his men,
column3: Grim Hagen's men went down. But though dozens of ill-aimed shots were fired at him, Grim Hagen still lived, dodging here and there, rallying his men,

column2: and urging his gun-crew to finish setting up that odd weapon.
column3: and urging his gun-crew to finish setting up that odd weapon.

column2: Few were left of the thousand that had rallied to Grim Hagen. But another thousand were coming through the hedges from other lanes and streets.
column3: Few were left of the thousand that had rallied to Grim Hagen. But another thousand were coming through the hedges from other lanes and streets.

column2: Although it was a gallant, ragged little army that Nea and Maya led, it would have lasted no longer than a straw in a whirlwind had it not been for the Kalis.
column3: Although it was a gallant, ragged little army that Nea and Maya led, it would have lasted no longer than a straw in a whirlwind had it not been for the Kalis.

column2: They appeared to be enjoying themselves, even as Grim Hagen's men were not. They zig-zagged this way and that. They purred. They fed.
column3: They appeared to be enjoying themselves, even as Grim Hagen's men were not. They zig-zagged this way and that. They purred. They fed.

column2: They were stronger now and their movements were quicker. Their victims died faster.
column3: They were stronger now and their movements were quicker. Their victims died faster.

column2: And as they forged forward, Nea was growing in strength. She leaped after them, leaving Maya to command the small army. She screamed.
column3: And as they forged forward, Nea was growing in strength. She leaped after them, leaving Maya to command the small army. She screamed.

column2: She urged them on with a Kill, kill, kill! that froze the back of Odin's neck. Here was no girl trained to work in a laboratory.
column3: She urged them on with a Kill, kill, kill! that froze the back of Odin's neck. Here was no girl trained to work in a laboratory.

column2: This was a high-priestess, long derided and forgotten, come back from the stars to wreak her vengeance.
column3: This was a high-priestess, long derided and forgotten, come back from the stars to wreak her vengeance.

column2: Good God, Odin was thinking. What unexplored labyrinths are left in the human brain?
column3: Good God, Odin was thinking. What unexplored labyrinths are left in the human brain?

column2: Then there was no time for thinking. The Lorens who were trying to gain the stairway had finally dislodged the two bodies that Odin and Gunnar had flung down upon them.
column3: Then there was no time for thinking. The Lorens who were trying to gain the stairway had finally dislodged the two bodies that Odin and Gunnar had flung down upon them.

column2: They came up like a surging tide, and for the next few minutes Odin and Gunnar were busy.
column3: They came up like a surging tide, and for the next few minutes Odin and Gunnar were busy.

column2: Gunnar had never been any happier in his life. He talked to his sword and he growled at those that he killed. He yelled at Ato's and Maya's wearying armies, urging them to go on and account themselves well.
column3: Gunnar had never been any happier in his life. He talked to his sword and he growled at those that he killed. He yelled at Ato's and Maya's wearying armies, urging them to go on and account themselves well.

column2: He stood by Odin's side, and the two hacked and thrust until the stairway was chocked with bodies and no one was left to assail them.
column3: He stood by Odin's side, and the two hacked and thrust until the stairway was chocked with bodies and no one was left to assail them.

column2: He and Odin were splashed with blood. The tumult was deafening. The tiger-screams of the Kalis, the agonized torment of their prey.
column3: He and Odin were splashed with blood. The tumult was deafening. The tiger-screams of the Kalis, the agonized torment of their prey.

column2: The gun-blasts from Maya's army, the cry of Ato who had hacked his way almost to Gunnar and Odin, the victory-scream of Nea, the broken music!
column3: The gun-blasts from Maya's army, the cry of Ato who had hacked his way almost to Gunnar and Odin, the victory-scream of Nea, the broken music!

column2: And even above this, the mad curses and commands of Grim Hagen!
column3: And even above this, the mad curses and commands of Grim Hagen!

column2: Some of Grim Hagen's Lorens were in flight. Most of them were dead. But his white-skinned warriors held firm. Not over a dozen were left at Grim Hagen's side.
column3: Some of Grim Hagen's Lorens were in flight. Most of them were dead. But his white-skinned warriors held firm. Not over a dozen were left at Grim Hagen's side.

column2: Two were still working with the odd-shaped weapon.
column3: Two were still working with the odd-shaped weapon.

column2: There were other Lorens coming out of the hedges, but they held back.
column3: There were other Lorens coming out of the hedges, but they held back.

column2: They had seen enough.
column3: They had seen enough.

column2: Had fortune favored Ato then, his army would have won.
column3: Had fortune favored Ato then, his army would have won.

column2: But at the precise moment when the balance was swinging toward the Brons, Grim Hagen's gun-crew got the strange weapon unlimbered.
column3: But at the precise moment when the balance was swinging toward the Brons, Grim Hagen's gun-crew got the strange weapon unlimbered.

column2: The globe started turning. Unseen motors roared within it. As though spun out like gleaming strands of cobwebs, coils of light came flickering toward the attacking Brons.
column3: The globe started turning. Unseen motors roared within it. As though spun out like gleaming strands of cobwebs, coils of light came flickering toward the attacking Brons.

column2: Like blue-white ripples they went across the fore-running Kalis.
column3: Like blue-white ripples they went across the fore-running Kalis.

column2: The ripples of light went on expanding. The shotgun in the hands of the old Bron suddenly burst to pieces. The old rifles fell apart.
column3: The ripples of light went on expanding. The shotgun in the hands of the old Bron suddenly burst to pieces. The old rifles fell apart.

column2: The newer machine-guns talked briefly, and then disappeared in a burst of flame that took their masters with them.
column3: The newer machine-guns talked briefly, and then disappeared in a burst of flame that took their masters with them.

column2: The first coil of light struck Odin. There was a tingling sensation, neither painful nor pleasant. But it went through his body like a mild opiate.
column3: The first coil of light struck Odin. There was a tingling sensation, neither painful nor pleasant. But it went through his body like a mild opiate.

column2: He did not want to sleep. He merely wanted to relax and forget this slaughter. He fought against it. Gunnar leaned against him, suddenly weak and shaken.
column3: He did not want to sleep. He merely wanted to relax and forget this slaughter. He fought against it. Gunnar leaned against him, suddenly weak and shaken.

column2: More widening circles of light swept out upon them. Ato's and Maya's troops fell back. Those who had been armed with explosive weapons had died.
column3: More widening circles of light swept out upon them. Ato's and Maya's troops fell back. Those who had been armed with explosive weapons had died.

column2: Odin was almost too weak to lift his sword. From the stairway below came a scrabbling sound, as men pulled the corpses away from the stairs.
column3: Odin was almost too weak to lift his sword. From the stairway below came a scrabbling sound, as men pulled the corpses away from the stairs.

column2: Nea's Kalis reeled back. She urged them on and they advanced like corks bobbing on ripples of light. Three moved slowly toward Grim Hagen's machine.
column3: Nea's Kalis reeled back. She urged them on and they advanced like corks bobbing on ripples of light. Three moved slowly toward Grim Hagen's machine.

column2: A fourth faltered and fell back.
column3: A fourth faltered and fell back.

column2: The Kalis were no longer screaming their frightful song. The purr of victory was gone. Instead they yowled a savage, tormented scream as though they had been cornered by an enemy they could not understand.
column3: The Kalis were no longer screaming their frightful song. The purr of victory was gone. Instead they yowled a savage, tormented scream as though they had been cornered by an enemy they could not understand.

column2: But the three moved forward, while the fourth hesitated behind them. As though struggling against a heavy flood they came on.
column3: But the three moved forward, while the fourth hesitated behind them. As though struggling against a heavy flood they came on.

column2: The gun-crew died defending their whirling weapon. The three Kalis swarmed over it like bees smothering the enemy, Odin thought. The pulsing coiling light died.
column3: The gun-crew died defending their whirling weapon. The three Kalis swarmed over it like bees smothering the enemy, Odin thought. The pulsing coiling light died.

column2: There was a burst of flame. The weapon and the three Kalis suddenly became one immense sardonyx that blazed huge and grand for a brief moment.
column3: There was a burst of flame. The weapon and the three Kalis suddenly became one immense sardonyx that blazed huge and grand for a brief moment.

column2: Then the jewel-blaze burned out, and a handful of ashes sifted to the ground.
column3: Then the jewel-blaze burned out, and a handful of ashes sifted to the ground.

column2: The fourth Kali was undone. It tried to go forward against that jewel-fire.
column3: The fourth Kali was undone. It tried to go forward against that jewel-fire.

column2: Then it hesitated and darted back. With a shrill cry of fear it flung itself into Nea's arms, its coppery tentacles holding her close in a last effort to escape destruction.
column3: Then it hesitated and darted back. With a shrill cry of fear it flung itself into Nea's arms, its coppery tentacles holding her close in a last effort to escape destruction.

column2: She had said before that the Kalis were the nearest things to human that could be made. She had been the poor relation, the daughter of a dreaming failure.
column3: She had said before that the Kalis were the nearest things to human that could be made. She had been the poor relation, the daughter of a dreaming failure.

column2: Perhaps something of the fear and doubt which Nea had known all her life had gone into the making of the Kalis. She screamed once more in bewilderment than pain,
column3: Perhaps something of the fear and doubt which Nea had known all her life had gone into the making of the Kalis. She screamed once more in bewilderment than pain,

column2: as though a favorite cat had suddenly clawed her.
column3: as though a favorite cat had suddenly clawed her.

column2: She must have been dead before she fell, and the last Kali clung to her bosom and spread its copper-wires about her face.
column3: She must have been dead before she fell, and the last Kali clung to her bosom and spread its copper-wires about her face.

column2: It emitted one weak purr then it stopped purring and moving forever.
column3: It emitted one weak purr then it stopped purring and moving forever.

column2: Grim Hagen's Lorens who had been clinging to the hedges now came forward triumphantly. Strength came back to Gunnar and Odin.
column3: Grim Hagen's Lorens who had been clinging to the hedges now came forward triumphantly. Strength came back to Gunnar and Odin.

column2: The attackers had cleared the stairway again. And once more Gunnar and Odin threw them back.
column3: The attackers had cleared the stairway again. And once more Gunnar and Odin threw them back.

column2: By now both Ato and Maya had swung their shattered little armies over to the subway entrance.
column3: By now both Ato and Maya had swung their shattered little armies over to the subway entrance.

column2: Hagen had retreated from the dais. Meeting the advancing Lorens, he led them forward.
column3: Hagen had retreated from the dais. Meeting the advancing Lorens, he led them forward.

column2: Those on the stairway retreated as they saw that they were no longer against two warriors.
column3: Those on the stairway retreated as they saw that they were no longer against two warriors.

column2: Gunnar rested his sword against his leg and reached out with huge arms and pulled Ato and Odin toward him. Down there, he pointed toward the stairway.
column3: Gunnar rested his sword against his leg and reached out with huge arms and pulled Ato and Odin toward him. Down there, he pointed toward the stairway.

column2: There is plenty of room to fight, and those who have been coming up don't seem to be so strong. Force your way down there and make another stand.
column3: There is plenty of room to fight, and those who have been coming up don't seem to be so strong. Force your way down there and make another stand.

column2: Make a barricade if you can. Up here you will soon be surrounded.
column3: Make a barricade if you can. Up here you will soon be surrounded.

column2: But Grim Hagen will be at our heels Odin protested.
column3: But Grim Hagen will be at our heels Odin protested.

column2: Gunnar laughed deep in his throat. Oh, no. The stairway is narrow. A strong man could hold the entrance for some time perhaps a long, long time.
column3: Gunnar laughed deep in his throat. Oh, no. The stairway is narrow. A strong man could hold the entrance for some time perhaps a long, long time.

column2: And Gunnar is strong. To get at you, Grim Hagen would either have to go down this stairway or take another entrance. These entrances, are few and far apart.
column3: And Gunnar is strong. To get at you, Grim Hagen would either have to go down this stairway or take another entrance. These entrances, are few and far apart.

column2: Go with Maya, Ato, Odin said, and I will stay here with Gunnar.
column3: Go with Maya, Ato, Odin said, and I will stay here with Gunnar.

column2: No. The entrance is narrow. You would be in the way, Gunnar protested.
column3: No. The entrance is narrow. You would be in the way, Gunnar protested.

column2: Now, go! Oh, but the valkyries will be busy tonight!
column3: Now, go! Oh, but the valkyries will be busy tonight!

column2: Ato and Odin led the rush down the stairs. There were only a dozen men below and they had already tired of warfare. Three fell and the others rushed off into the shadows.
column3: Ato and Odin led the rush down the stairs. There were only a dozen men below and they had already tired of warfare. Three fell and the others rushed off into the shadows.

column2: Ato's and Maya's fighters tumbled after them. There were only a few of the old people and children left.
column3: Ato's and Maya's fighters tumbled after them. There were only a few of the old people and children left.

column2: Now they found themselves in a huge room which was filled with benches and small machines. It was evidently a wood-working shop.
column3: Now they found themselves in a huge room which was filled with benches and small machines. It was evidently a wood-working shop.

column2: The room was lit by several of the high-flaring cressets of stone. It was rectangular, about the size of a football field.
column3: The room was lit by several of the high-flaring cressets of stone. It was rectangular, about the size of a football field.

column2: They were fortunate that there was no heavy machinery left here. From each side, dim-lighted tunnels led off into the distance.
column3: They were fortunate that there was no heavy machinery left here. From each side, dim-lighted tunnels led off into the distance.

column2: While Odin and the strongest soldiers guarded, Ato and his people shoved benches, tables and chairs to the four tunnels and set them afire.
column3: While Odin and the strongest soldiers guarded, Ato and his people shoved benches, tables and chairs to the four tunnels and set them afire.

column2: There were still quite a number of benches left, and some of these were stacked close together into one corner of the room, making a sort of rude balcony that looked down upon the littered floor.
column3: There were still quite a number of benches left, and some of these were stacked close together into one corner of the room, making a sort of rude balcony that looked down upon the littered floor.

column2: More benches and machines were left. These were made into a barricade a few yards in front of the balcony.
column3: More benches and machines were left. These were made into a barricade a few yards in front of the balcony.

column2: All was done now that could be done. So Odin rushed back to the stairway to help Gunnar. But his heart sank as he stood at the foot of the stairs.
column3: All was done now that could be done. So Odin rushed back to the stairway to help Gunnar. But his heart sank as he stood at the foot of the stairs.

column2: Up there was nothing but swirling, violet flame. Some liquid was burning furiously at the entrance-way, and blazing rivulets were pouring down the steps.
column3: Up there was nothing but swirling, violet flame. Some liquid was burning furiously at the entrance-way, and blazing rivulets were pouring down the steps.

column2: There was no way to go through those flames. There was now no way to go around. Gunnar, if he lived at all, must fight alone.
column3: There was no way to go through those flames. There was now no way to go around. Gunnar, if he lived at all, must fight alone.

column2: And Odin's eyes filled with tears as he cursed himself for deserting his old comrade.
column3: And Odin's eyes filled with tears as he cursed himself for deserting his old comrade.

column2: The attackers were almost upon Gunnar before the last of Maya's rag-tag army had gone down the stairs. There were high bannisters around the entrance-way.
column3: The attackers were almost upon Gunnar before the last of Maya's rag-tag army had gone down the stairs. There were high bannisters around the entrance-way.

column2: These afforded plenty of protection to his back and flanks unless someone scaled them, which he doubted. One of the heavy cressets was burning nearby.
column3: These afforded plenty of protection to his back and flanks unless someone scaled them, which he doubted. One of the heavy cressets was burning nearby.

column2: It seemed to be no more than a huge, open lamp. Standing upon a circular base about three feet across, the twelve-inch stem went up nearly eight feet and then flared out into a tulip-shaped bowl that was filled with flickering violet fire.
column3: It seemed to be no more than a huge, open lamp. Standing upon a circular base about three feet across, the twelve-inch stem went up nearly eight feet and then flared out into a tulip-shaped bowl that was filled with flickering violet fire.

column2: Bending low, Gunnar grasped the bottom of the stem and moved it a little closer to the stairway entrance. It took all of his strength, but it moved, complaining as it slid along the flagging.
column3: Bending low, Gunnar grasped the bottom of the stem and moved it a little closer to the stairway entrance. It took all of his strength, but it moved, complaining as it slid along the flagging.

column2: Now he was almost under it. The light was in his opponents' faces, and it gave a little added protection to his left side.
column3: Now he was almost under it. The light was in his opponents' faces, and it gave a little added protection to his left side.

column2: Gunnar braced himself, his long blade high over his shoulder, both hands locked to the long carved haft.
column3: Gunnar braced himself, his long blade high over his shoulder, both hands locked to the long carved haft.

column2: Grim Hagen, he called mockingly. Here we are at the edge of the stars.
column3: Grim Hagen, he called mockingly. Here we are at the edge of the stars.

column2: Just you and I left on top of this world. Just you and I of the two crews that sailed from Opal. The mad gods have made bonfires of the suns.
column3: Just you and I left on top of this world. Just you and I of the two crews that sailed from Opal. The mad gods have made bonfires of the suns.

column2: Ragnarok has come and passed. I have no quarrel with these people, Grim Hagen. Come forward now and let the two of us end what should have been ended long ago Grim Hagen silenced his men and screamed back: Gunnar, what I say now I have said before.
column3: Ragnarok has come and passed. I have no quarrel with these people, Grim Hagen. Come forward now and let the two of us end what should have been ended long ago Grim Hagen silenced his men and screamed back: Gunnar, what I say now I have said before.

column2: I promised you death. But I will let you go free and all the frightened rats below can go free if you will give me Wolden's secret I know nothing of Wolden's secret.
column3: I promised you death. But I will let you go free and all the frightened rats below can go free if you will give me Wolden's secret I know nothing of Wolden's secret.

column2: It may be nothing but a twitch in your mad brain. The old Blood-Drinker and I know but one secret, Grim Hagen, the secret of death.
column3: It may be nothing but a twitch in your mad brain. The old Blood-Drinker and I know but one secret, Grim Hagen, the secret of death.

column2: Step forth like a man now and I promise you more peace than even Wolden's secret could give you.
column3: Step forth like a man now and I promise you more peace than even Wolden's secret could give you.

column2: Grim Hagen said no more to Gunnar. He sent four companies in the direction of other entrances to the underground city. Then he martialled his remaining men and threw them toward Gunnar in threes.
column3: Grim Hagen said no more to Gunnar. He sent four companies in the direction of other entrances to the underground city. Then he martialled his remaining men and threw them toward Gunnar in threes.

column2: Three by three they came, and three by three they went down. Braced on his strong, short legs Gunnar flailed them like wheat.
column3: Three by three they came, and three by three they went down. Braced on his strong, short legs Gunnar flailed them like wheat.

column2: Screams and curses filled the night. And Gunnar piled the dead before him.
column3: Screams and curses filled the night. And Gunnar piled the dead before him.

column2: One by one the companies returned to Grim Hagen and reported that for the present there was no other way into the room below.
column3: One by one the companies returned to Grim Hagen and reported that for the present there was no other way into the room below.

column2: Grim Hagen held a short council of war. He had less than a score of the white-skinned soldiers left. These he sent at Gunnar in a body, and came following after with the remaining Lorens.
column3: Grim Hagen held a short council of war. He had less than a score of the white-skinned soldiers left. These he sent at Gunnar in a body, and came following after with the remaining Lorens.

column2: Gunnar cut them down, but a leaping soldier died as he buried his knife in Gunnar's side. The Lorens were throwing sticks and stones when they could.
column3: Gunnar cut them down, but a leaping soldier died as he buried his knife in Gunnar's side. The Lorens were throwing sticks and stones when they could.

column2: They closed in like dogs upon a wolf. Gunnar reeled back and then advanced once more as he swung his broadsword.
column3: They closed in like dogs upon a wolf. Gunnar reeled back and then advanced once more as he swung his broadsword.

column2: He cleared a path and sent his attackers back until they stood about him in a circle, their fangs ready.
column3: He cleared a path and sent his attackers back until they stood about him in a circle, their fangs ready.

column2: And then Gunnar reached forth and took the stem of the huge torch high up in his hands and bowed his back. The lamp rocked upon its pedestal and then came crashing forward.
column3: And then Gunnar reached forth and took the stem of the huge torch high up in his hands and bowed his back. The lamp rocked upon its pedestal and then came crashing forward.

column2: Its fuel spilled down and caught fire as it fell.
column3: Its fuel spilled down and caught fire as it fell.

column2: Flames leaped up and lashed out at the Lorens.
column3: Flames leaped up and lashed out at the Lorens.

column2: The fierce flames drove the attackers farther back. But in falling, the great lamp careened and half of its liquid had splashed across the entrance to the tunnel.
column3: The fierce flames drove the attackers farther back. But in falling, the great lamp careened and half of its liquid had splashed across the entrance to the tunnel.

column2: It caught fire. Gunnar gasped as it struck him. Then he strode forward, like a dwarf-king advancing from Hell.

column2: The twilight is past and new suns and new earths are quickened. And Gunnar still lives.
